title: Antiforeigner Attacks Strain Ties Among African Countries
text:
JOHANNESBURG—A spate of attacks in South Africa this week against foreigners from other African nations has highlighted the failures of governments continentwide to tackle deep inequalities and crippling poverty, observers say.

Since Sunday, nearly 450 people have been arrested in South Africa for violent offenses related to xenophobic attacks, and at least 10 people have been killed, including two foreigners, according to South African President Cyril Ramaphosa.
